headline: AMD earnings, Netflix-Warner Bros. hearing: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Tuesday, February 3, including earnings results from companies like Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG), Pfizer (PFE), and Merck (MRK), and the Senate hearing on Netflix's (NFLX) proposed bid to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

summary: PayPal Holdings (NasdaqGS:PYPL) has partnered with Authvia to let PayPal and Venmo users send and receive payments through text messaging and RCS. headline: PayPal Stock Sinks After Company Warns of Earnings Drop and Names New CEO
summary: PayPal (PYPL) stock plumbed multiyear lows after the payments company warned earnings will fall this year. PayPal named Enrique Lores, who had been serving as HP's chief executive, as its next CEO.    Shares dropped about 15% in premarket trading, recently standing at $44.

headline: PayPal (NASDAQ:PYPL) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q4 CY2025 Earnings, Stock Drops 14.6%
summary: Digital payments platform PayPal (NASDAQ:PYPL) fell short of the markets revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025 as sales rose 3.7% year on year to $8.68 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.23 per share was 4.5% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: PayPal (NASDAQ:PYPL) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q4 CY2025 Earnings, Stock Drops 14.6%
content.summary: Digital payments platform PayPal (NASDAQ:PYPL) fell short of the markets revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025 as sales rose 3.7% year on year to $8.68 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.23 per share was 4.5% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Paypal: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of 14 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.29 per share. The technology platform and digital payments company posted revenue of $8.68 billion in the period, which also missed Street forecasts. Twelve analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $8.77 billion.

content.title: Paypal: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: The average estimate of 14 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.29 per share. The technology platform and digital payments company posted revenue of $8.68 billion in the period, which also missed Street forecasts. Twelve analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $8.77 billion.

headline: PayPal sees 2026 profit below estimates, names HP's Lores as CEO
summary: PayPal issued a lackluster profit forecast for 2026 and reported fourth-quarter earnings below Wall Street expectations on Tuesday, while naming HP's Enrique Lores as its president ​and CEO.  Shares of the company slumped nearly 16% in premarket trading, after the payments giant's board ‌said the pace of change and execution under current CEO Alex Chriss was not in line with its expectations.  Chriss was tasked with ‌steering PayPal through a challenging period as post-pandemic trading volumes declined and competitive pressures in its core business from large technology companies and newer fintech rivals intensified.

content.title: PayPal sees 2026 profit below estimates, names HP's Lores as CEO
content.summary: PayPal issued a lackluster profit forecast for 2026 and reported fourth-quarter earnings below Wall Street expectations on Tuesday, while naming HP's Enrique Lores as its president ​and CEO.  Shares of the company slumped nearly 16% in premarket trading, after the payments giant's board ‌said the pace of change and execution under current CEO Alex Chriss was not in line with its expectations.  Chriss was tasked with ‌steering PayPal through a challenging period as post-pandemic trading volumes declined and competitive pressures in its core business from large technology companies and newer fintech rivals intensified.

headline: PayPal Appoints Enrique Lores as Chief Executive Officer and David W. Dorman as Independent Board Chair
summary: PayPal Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: PYPL) today announced that its Board of Directors has appointed Enrique Lores as President and CEO, effective March 1, 2026. Lores, who has served on the PayPal Board for nearly five years and as Board Chair since July 2024, succeeds Alex Chriss. To ensure a seamless transition, Jamie Miller, Chief Financial and Operating Officer, will serve as Interim CEO until Lores assumes the role. David W. Dorman has been appointed as Independent Board Chair, effective immediat

headline: PayPal (PYPL) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Jamie Miller: Before we turn to our full year and fourth quarter, I want to address the leadership announcement we made earlier this morning.  The board has appointed Enrique Lopez, who was most recently our board chair, as the next president and CEO of PayPal Holdings, Inc. effective March 1.  To accelerate execution and bring greater discipline to how we implement our strategic priorities as we enter our next phase of growth.

content.title: PayPal (PYPL) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
content.summary: Jamie Miller: Before we turn to our full year and fourth quarter, I want to address the leadership announcement we made earlier this morning.  The board has appointed Enrique Lopez, who was most recently our board chair, as the next president and CEO of PayPal Holdings, Inc. effective March 1.  To accelerate execution and bring greater discipline to how we implement our strategic priorities as we enter our next phase of growth.

headline: S&P 500, Nasdaq poised for higher open as earnings deluge takes center stage
summary: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq looked set for a firm open on Tuesday, stabilizing after a commodity rout in the previous session, as investors geared up for ​a flood of corporate results through the week.  Palantir Technologies jumped 11.2% in premarket trading after upbeat results highlighted demand ‌for its military-grade AI tools, with U.S. defense spending helping lift quarterly sales.  "Palantir's good earnings is helpful for the AI trade," said John Campbell, senior portfolio manager, Allspring Global Investments.

Palantir Technologies jumped 11.2% in premarket trading after upbeat results highlighted demand ‌for its military-grade AI tools, with U.S. defense spending helping lift quarterly sales.  "Palantir's good earnings is helpful for the AI trade," said John Campbell, senior portfolio manager, Allspring Global Investments.

headline: PayPal Poaches HP’s CEO in Rare Tech Leadership Raid – What HP Knows That We Don’t
summary: PayPal Holdings (NASDAQ:PYPL) just did something nearly unheard of in Silicon Valley: it poached a sitting CEO from another public company. Enrique Lores, who led HP Inc (NYSE:HPQ) through six consecutive quarters of revenue growth, is now PayPal’s new chief executive as of February 3, 2026. This wasn’t a quiet retirement transition or a graceful ... PayPal Poaches HP’s CEO in Rare Tech Leadership Raid – What HP Knows That We Don’t

headline: PayPal replaces CEO Chriss with HP's Lores
summary: PayPal is replacing CEO Alex Chriss with Enrique Lores, saying that the pace of change and execution at the company has not met board expectations over the past two years.  Lores has served as a PayPal board member for almost five years and has been board Chair since July 2024.  “The payments industry is changing faster than ever, driven by new technologies, evolving regulations, an increasingly competitive landscape, and the rapid acceleration of AI that is reshaping commerce daily,” Lores said in a statement on Tuesday.

content.title: PayPal replaces CEO Chriss with HP's Lores
content.summary: PayPal is replacing CEO Alex Chriss with Enrique Lores, saying that the pace of change and execution at the company has not met board expectations over the past two years.  Lores has served as a PayPal board member for almost five years and has been board Chair since July 2024.  “The payments industry is changing faster than ever, driven by new technologies, evolving regulations, an increasingly competitive landscape, and the rapid acceleration of AI that is reshaping commerce daily,” Lores said in a statement on Tuesday.

headline: PayPal Names HP Inc.’s Lores as CEO and Misses Earnings Estimates. Stock Drops 17%.
summary: PayPal Holdings  made a splash Tuesday as it attempts to engineer a turnaround, replacing CEO Alex Chriss with current  HP Inc.  Chief Executive Enrique Lores.  Lores, who has served as HP’s CEO since 2019, will take the helm on March 1.  Jamie Miller, PayPal’s chief financial and operating officer, will serve as interim CEO for the rest of the month.

content.title: PayPal Names HP Inc.’s Lores as CEO and Misses Earnings Estimates. Stock Drops 17%.
content.summary: PayPal Holdings  made a splash Tuesday as it attempts to engineer a turnaround, replacing CEO Alex Chriss with current  HP Inc.  Chief Executive Enrique Lores.  Lores, who has served as HP’s CEO since 2019, will take the helm on March 1.  Jamie Miller, PayPal’s chief financial and operating officer, will serve as interim CEO for the rest of the month.

headline: HP stock drops 6% as CEO Enrique Lores exits for PayPal
summary: Investing.com -- HP Inc. (NYSE:HPQ) stock fell 6% Tuesday after the company announced that CEO Enrique Lores has stepped down to pursue another opportunity, with PayPal Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ:PYPL) simultaneously revealing his appointment as their next President and CEO.

headline: PayPal Names New CEO as Profit Misses Targets
summary: PayPal Holdings said HP Inc. CEO Enrique Lores will take the top job from Alex Chriss, whose turnaround plan failed to meet targets. Paige Smith reports on "Bloomberg Open Interest."

content.title: PayPal Names New CEO as Profit Misses Targets
content.description: PayPal Holdings said HP Inc. CEO Enrique Lores will take the top job from Alex Chriss, whose turnaround plan failed to meet targets. Paige Smith reports on "Bloomberg Open Interest."
content.summary: PayPal Holdings said HP Inc. CEO Enrique Lores will take the top job from Alex Chriss, whose turnaround plan failed to meet targets. Paige Smith reports on "Bloomberg Open Interest."

headline: PayPal Names HP Inc.’s Lores as CEO and Misses Earnings Estimates. Stock Drops 18%.
summary: PayPal Holdings  made a splash Tuesday as it attempts to engineer a turnaround, replacing CEO Alex Chriss with current  HP Inc.  Chief Executive Enrique Lores.  Lores, who has served as HP’s CEO since 2019, will take the helm on March 1.  Jamie Miller, PayPal’s chief financial and operating officer, will serve as interim CEO for the rest of the month.

content.title: PayPal Names HP Inc.’s Lores as CEO and Misses Earnings Estimates. Stock Drops 18%.
content.summary: PayPal Holdings  made a splash Tuesday as it attempts to engineer a turnaround, replacing CEO Alex Chriss with current  HP Inc.  Chief Executive Enrique Lores.  Lores, who has served as HP’s CEO since 2019, will take the helm on March 1.  Jamie Miller, PayPal’s chief financial and operating officer, will serve as interim CEO for the rest of the month.

headline: Stocks to Watch Tuesday: PayPal, PepsiCo, AMD, Disney
summary: ↘️ Pfizer (PFE): The drugmaker reported lower quarterly sales and swung to a loss, as demand for its Covid-19 vaccine and antiviral drug continued to decline. Shares lost about 4%. ↘️ NXP Semiconductors (NXPI): The Dutch chip maker reported higher quarterly sales and guided for further revenue growth, as management sees rising demand.

headline: Paypal (PYPL) Q4 Earnings and Revenues Miss Estimates
summary: Paypal (PYPL) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of -4.36% and -1.07%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: PayPal shares plunge as Q4 results miss estimates, new CEO named
summary: Investing.com -- PayPal Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:PYPL) shares fell over 17% on Tuesday after the digital payments giant reported fourth quarter earnings and revenue that missed analyst expectations, overshadowing its slightly higher-than-expected guidance for fiscal 2026.

content.title: PayPal shares plunge as Q4 results miss estimates, new CEO named
content.summary: Investing.com -- PayPal Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:PYPL) shares fell over 17% on Tuesday after the digital payments giant reported fourth quarter earnings and revenue that missed analyst expectations, overshadowing its slightly higher-than-expected guidance for fiscal 2026.

headline: PayPal shares sink on CEO exit, disappointing 2026 profit forecast
summary: PayPal replaced its CEO Alex Chriss, who was brought in to steer the payments firm through slowing growth and heightened competition, and simultaneously issued a lackluster profit forecast for 2026 on Tuesday, ​sending its shares down 19%.  The company's board, which named HP's Enrique Lores as its new president and CEO, said the ‌pace of change and execution under Chriss was not in line with its expectations.  Chriss was tasked with turning around PayPal during a challenging period as post-pandemic trading ‌volumes declined and competitive pressures in its core business from large technology companies and newer fintech rivals intensified.

Chriss was tasked with turning around PayPal during a challenging period as post-pandemic trading ‌volumes declined and competitive pressures in its core business from large technology companies and newer fintech rivals intensified.
